description.narrative: 1) Contribute to peace in Mali and to reconciliation and dialogue between all sectors of the population2) Promote professionalization of the Malian media sector through an original media platform with a network of professional journalists throughout the country.

Insatsen syftar till att öka tillgången till opartiska nyheter och information i hela landet och att därigenom stärka yttrandefrihet och ansvarsutkrävande, samt förbättra demokratiskt beslutsfattande. Genom att öka förståelse och kunskap avser insatsen bidra till fred, försoning och dialog. Detta ska ske genom att dagligen producera nyheter och debattprogram, som sänds genom ett nätverk av oberoende radiokanaler. Studio Tamani är även aktiva på Twitter och lägger ut alla debattprogram på Youtube. Under projektperioden är ambitionen att även utöka sändningen till TV och genom mobiltelefonlösningar. Studio Tamani har 30 anställda journalister, som får kontinuerlig utbildning och stöd i syfte att stärka deras professionella kapacitet.

The contribution aims to increase the access to impartial news and information throughout the country, thereby strengthening freedom of speech and accountability, and improving democratic decision-making. Through increasing understanding and knowledge the contribution strives to contribute to peace, reconciliation and dialogue. This will be ensured through the daily production of news and debate programs, which are broadcast through a network of independent radios. Studio Tamani are also active on Twitter and post all debate programs on Youtube. During the project period, the aim is to increase the broadcasting to TV and mobile telephone solutions. Studio Tamani has 30 employed journalists, who receive continous training and support in order to strengthen their professional capacity.

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

tag.narrative: 13.3 - Förbättra utbildningen, medvetenheten och den mänskliga och institutionella kapaciteten vad gäller begränsning av klimatförändringarna, klimatanpassning, begränsning av klimatförändringarnas konsekvenser samt tidig varning.
13.3 - Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning.
16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.b - Enhance the use of enabling technology, in particular information and communications technology, to promote the empowerment of women.
5.b - Öka användningen av gynnsam teknik, i synnerhet informations- och kommunikationsteknik, för att främja kvinnors egenmakt

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Based on final reporting and other communication, results achieved over the project period can be summarised as follows: - The partner radios network was extended from 23 in early 2015 to 70 at the end of 2017. It has increased the program distribution across the country and made it accessible to a large majority of the Malian population. Since the end of 2017, 88% of the country's population has the opportunity to receive Studio Tamani programs. - Studio Tamani has responded throughout the three years to strong and sometimes vital information needs of the Malian population, through its daily treatment of topics directly related to crisis factors in the country. Its role as a forum and media platform essential to restore the channels of dialogue and peace has been strengthened through its talk-show"Le Grand Dialogue", broadcast daily by partner radios and in video version by a cable TV in Bamako. This program, recognized and appreciated in particular by the peace process actors, has given the floor to all Malian society components, including groups in conflict, on a daily basis. - The 3.15 hours daily program produced by Studio Tamani and broadcast by its partner radios network (1h on weekends and public holidays) is now well known, recognized and appreciated in all regions of the country especially those facing the most violent consequences of the crisis. According to the quantitative audience survey carried out by the IMMAR Institute in summer 2017, a third of the Malian population aged 15 and over regularly follows Studio Tamani. Listening rate is significantly higher in the north of the country. It exceeds 70% in Timbuktu and 60% in Gao. - The project's sustainability strategy focused on skills transfer to the Malian management team. In this regard, as of February 2018, 3 Malian executives have been appointed to the Studio Tamani Editorial Office. Since then, they have taken editorial responsibility for all the studio programs. - On the institutional level, the Malian legal structure that will eventually assume Studio Tamani governance was created in October 2017. It is the Tamani Association composed of URTEL, the Malian Research Institute -Action for Peace, a staff representative from Studio Tamani and Fondation Hirondelle.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
